Pre-Game Insights: Juan Antonio Pizzi has begun his tenure as Bahrain manager well, suffering just one defeat since taking charge.
Bahrain have never beaten the Socceroos in their five previous meetings, suffering a 1-0 defeat the last time around at the 2011 Asian Cup.

Australia enter 2024 full of confidence, fresh off successive victories in November, putting them at the top of their second-round World Cup qualifying group with a 2-0 record and without a goal conceded.

Since losing 1-0 versus Saudi Arabia in a March 2022 World Cup qualifier, the Socceroos have won their last four competitive games versus Asian opponents, outscoring them by a combined margin of 10-1 over that stretch.
Australia boast an all-time 100% record versus Bahrain, conceding only once in their five previous encounters against them (3-1 win at the 2006 Asian Cup).
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is part of preparation for the upcoming Asian Cup.
Both teams aim to perform well in the Asian Cup, with Bahrain in a tough group with South Korea, Jordan, and Malaysia, and Australia in a group with India, Syria, and Uzbekistan.
